geoengineering.name: Carbon Dioxide Removal
geoengineering.description: Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDR) is a type of geoengineering that involves removing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere to reduce global warming. This can be done through various methods such as direct air capture, bioenergy with carbon capture and storage, and ocean fertilization.

geoengineering.name: Solar Radiation Management
geoengineering.description: Solar Radiation Management (SRM) is a type of geoengineering that involves reflecting sunlight away from the Earth to reduce global warming. This can be done through various methods such as injecting aerosols into the atmosphere, increasing the albedo of clouds, and deploying space-based mirrors.

geoengineering.name: Cloud Albedo Enhancement
geoengineering.description: Cloud Albedo Enhancement (CAE) is a type of geoengineering that involves increasing the reflectivity of clouds to reduce global warming. This can be done through various methods such as seeding clouds with reflective particles, increasing the amount of aerosols in the atmosphere, and deploying space-based mirrors.

geoengineering.name: Ocean Fertilization
geoengineering.description: Ocean Fertilization is a type of geoengineering that involves adding nutrients to the ocean to increase the growth of phytoplankton which can absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as adding iron to the ocean, adding nitrogen and phosphorus, and deploying floating devices.

geoengineering.name: Direct Air Capture
geoengineering.description: Direct Air Capture (DAC) is a type of geoengineering that involves capturing carbon dioxide directly from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as using chemical filters, using adsorbents, and using membranes.

geoengineering.name: Bioenergy with Carbon Capture and Storage
geoengineering.description: Bioenergy with Carbon Capture and Storage (BECCS) is a type of geoengineering that involves burning biomass to generate energy while capturing and storing the carbon dioxide produced. This can be done through various methods such as using chemical filters, using adsorbents, and using membranes.

geoengineering.name: Afforestation and Reforestation
geoengineering.description: Afforestation and Reforestation (A&R) is a type of geoengineering that involves planting trees to absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as planting trees in existing forests, planting trees in deforested areas, and planting trees in urban areas.

geoengineering.name: Enhanced Weathering
geoengineering.description: Enhanced Weathering is a type of geoengineering that involves increasing the rate of weathering of rocks to absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as adding crushed rocks to soils, adding crushed rocks to oceans, and adding crushed rocks to lakes.

geoengineering.name: Ocean Alkalinity Enhancement
geoengineering.description: Ocean Alkalinity Enhancement (OAE) is a type of geoengineering that involves increasing the alkalinity of the ocean to absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as adding crushed rocks to the ocean, adding limestone to the ocean, and adding sodium bicarbonate to the ocean.

geoengineering.name: Artificial Trees
geoengineering.description: Artificial Trees are a type of geoengineering that involves using artificial devices to absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. This can be done through various methods such as using chemical filters, using adsorbents, and using membranes.

zia.name: Aircraft Design and Technology
zia.description: Research focused on the development of new aircraft designs and technologies that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as more efficient engines, quieter aircraft, and lighter materials.

zia.name: Air Traffic Management
zia.description: Research focused on the development of new air traffic management systems that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as more efficient flight routes, optimized airspace utilization, and improved air traffic control.

zia.name: Alternative Fuels
zia.description: Research focused on the development of alternative fuels for aviation, such as biofuels, hydrogen, and electric propulsion, that reduce the environmental impact of aviation.

zia.name: Aviation Emissions
zia.description: Research focused on the measurement and reduction of aviation emissions, such as carbon dioxide, nitrogen oxides, and particulate matter, that contribute to global climate change.

zia.name: Aviation Noise
zia.description: Research focused on the measurement and reduction of aviation noise, such as engine noise and sonic booms, that can cause disruption to communities.

zia.name: Carbon Offsetting
zia.description: Research focused on the development of carbon offsetting schemes for aviation, such as the purchase of carbon credits, that reduce the environmental impact of aviation.

zia.name: Eco-Friendly Airports
zia.description: Research focused on the development of eco-friendly airports that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of renewable energy sources, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Eco-Friendly Aircraft Operations
zia.description: Research focused on the development of eco-friendly aircraft operations that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as fuel-efficient flight paths, reduced engine idling, and optimized take-off and landing procedures.

zia.name: Eco-Friendly Maintenance
zia.description: Research focused on the development of eco-friendly maintenance practices that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of recycled materials, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Eco-Friendly Technologies
zia.description: Research focused on the development of eco-friendly technologies that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as electric aircraft, hydrogen fuel cells, and advanced aerodynamics.

zia.name: Environmental Impact Assessment
zia.description: Research focused on the assessment of the environmental impact of aviation, such as the measurement of carbon dioxide emissions, noise levels, and air pollution.

zia.name: Green Aviation
zia.description: Research focused on the development of green aviation initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of renewable energy sources, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Green Flight Paths
zia.description: Research focused on the development of green flight paths that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as fuel-efficient routes, optimized airspace utilization, and improved air traffic control.

zia.name: Green Logistics
zia.description: Research focused on the development of green logistics initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of renewable energy sources, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Green Technologies
zia.description: Research focused on the development of green technologies that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as electric aircraft, hydrogen fuel cells, and advanced aerodynamics.

zia.name: Noise Abatement
zia.description: Research focused on the development of noise abatement initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of quieter engines, improved flight paths, and optimized airspace utilization.

zia.name: Pollution Reduction
zia.description: Research focused on the development of pollution reduction initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of cleaner fuels, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Sustainable Aviation
zia.description: Research focused on the development of sustainable aviation initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of renewable energy sources, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.

zia.name: Sustainable Flight Paths
zia.description: Research focused on the development of sustainable flight paths that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as fuel-efficient routes, optimized airspace utilization, and improved air traffic control.

zia.name: Sustainable Logistics
zia.description: Research focused on the development of sustainable logistics initiatives that reduce the environmental impact of aviation, such as the use of renewable energy sources, improved waste management, and reduced water consumption.
